item.title: Mercedes-Benz’s 400kW EV chargers are coming to Starbucks
item.description:
Mercedes-Benz and Starbucks are teaming up to install fast electric vehicle chargers at 100 coffee-slinging locations on Interstate 5, which runs along the West Coast from Canada to Mexico.

The new stations will be part of the German automaker’s $1 billion plan to build 2,000 new EV charging hubs across the globe. Its first station, complete with a swanky waiting area and 400kW charging speeds courtesy of ChargePoint, opened in Atlanta last year.

Now it looks like Mercedes is ready to embark on the next phase of its installations, with a primary focus on Starbucks locations along I-5. The two companies said in the announcement that they “share an ambition to identify additional opportunities in key markets, including core urban areas,...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Andrew J. Hawkins

item.title: Shaped raises $8M Series A and launches its self-serve recommendations and search service
item.description:
Whether it’s an online marketplace, store, or social media platform, virtually every site today uses some kind of recommendation service to personalize its offerings. Shaped, which is announcing an $8 million seed funding round today, wants to make it easier for businesses of all sizes to combine the data they already have with large language […]

item.title: Menlo Ventures and Anthropic team up on a $100M AI fund
item.description:
Menlo Ventures and Anthropic are teaming up on a $100 million fund dubbed "the Anthology Fund" to invest in pre-seed and Series A AI startups.

item.title: Tinder can now pick your dating profile picture for you - The Verge
item.description:
1. Tinder can now pick your dating profile picture for you  The Verge
  2. AI Knows Best? Tinder Wants You to Let AI Pick the Best Profile Photos  CNET
  3. Tinder’s AI Photo Selector automatically picks the best photos for your dating profile  TechCrunch
  4. Tinder's new AI will pick your most attractive photos for you  Engadget
  5. Tinder's AI Can Examine Your Camera Roll, Choose Your Profile Picture  PCMag

item.title: Valve runs its massive PC gaming ecosystem with only about 350 employees - Ars Technica
item.description:
1. Valve runs its massive PC gaming ecosystem with only about 350 employees  Ars Technica
  2. Here’s how much Valve pays its staff — and how few people it employs  The Verge
  3. Court documents show that not only is Valve a fraction the size of companies like EA or Ubisoft, it's smaller than a lot of triple-A developers  PC Gamer
  4. Leaked Valve data reveals it's smaller than most AAA developers, let alone publishers – and The Witcher 4 seemingly has 5x more staff than the entirety of Steam  Gamesradar
  5. Court papers expose how much Valve pays its employees, and how many it has  ReadWrite

item.description: Prime Day 2024 is here, and Apple iPads are on sale starting at $249. Find the lowest price ever on the 10th generation iPad, iPad Air, and iPad Pro.

item.title: I went through all of the Prime Day tech deals and these 5 are the best
item.description: I scoured through a very long list of Prime Day deals. Here are five that I think are the best.

item.title: Best Prime Day Apple deals: Watches, AirPods, and iPads hit lowest-ever prices
item.description: Prime Day deals are bringing the heat. Apple AirPods Max are down to $394.99, and you can save 20% on the M2 MacBook Air, now just $799.

item.title: These five products are cheaper on Prime Day than they were on Black Friday
item.description: Prime Day and Black Friday mark two of the biggest shopping events of the season, but which is better? We've found five Prime Day deals that are cheaper than they were during Black Friday.
